title.default: Which statement best describes your relation to data?

text.default: I do consult and create data through delivering programs and services to citizens, businesses, not-for-profit organizations, academia or other levels of government.
I identify and interpret trends and patterns in datasets, and communicate conclusions and recommendations to decision makers and stakeholders.
I use advanced statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques for developing data solutions to business problems.
I make operational and strategic planning decisions based on analytical insights derived from data.

title.default: About You

title.default: Data Culture

I have experience in developing and overseeing compliance with privacy protection policies and procedures.

title.default: Data Ethics and Security

title.default: Asking the Right Questions

text.default: I use basic search engines like Google to try to find data.

title.default: Finding Data
Which strategies do you use to clean your data?

text.default: I did not know that data might have to be checked, cleaned or normalized. I use data as is.
I know that data is not perfect. I am aware of common data quality issues (e.g. empty fields, duplicates) and can manually fix errors.
I am very aware of data quality criteria (e.g. machine processable, empty fields, duplicate detection). I detect and remove invalid records using programs that support data cleaning.

I am able to remove invalid records and translate all the columns to use a same set of values through an automated script. I often combine different datasets into a single table, remove duplicate entries or apply any number of other normalizations.

title.default: Cleaning Data
Which strategies do you use in order to manage data?

text.default: I did not realize that data had to be managed to support the integrity, security and accessibility of the data.

I can collect, edit and store simple datasets in a spreadsheet. I am aware of the importance of creating appropriate metadata descriptors (e.g. author, date created, access rights) to fully document the data set.
I am able to design, implement and manage large databases, including big data environments and real-time dashboards. I follow data standards that are implemented across the organizations.

I integrate collected data with existing information systems, setting up data pipelines and improving the interoperability of data. I support the creation and maintenance of data dictionaries to document corporate datasets.
